dmca.title: Trademark Infringement; IP addresses 70.87.64.74 and 70.87.64.75; sent on behalf of J
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: Gutowski, Leslie [mailto:leslie.gutowski@finnegan.com] 
Sent: Friday, March 02, 2007 2:33 PM
To: Copyright
Cc: Matheson, Julia Anne
Subject: RE: Trademark Infringement; IP addresses 70.87.64.74 and
70.87.64.75; sent on behalf of Julia Anne Matheson, Esq.

Dear The Planet Representative, 

As shown on the attached printout of the infringing website, your
customer is using the PIZZA HUT mark, rendered as PizzaHut.com,
approximately 90 times on the website to drive Internet traffic to that
site. We note that viewing this material requiring scrolling down, as
your customer has misleadingly placed only a link titled "enter" on the
first viewable part of the screen. Accordingly, the infringement is not
domain name-related as your e-mail states. Rather, your customer's
flagrant misuse of Pizza Hut's PIZZA HUT mark on the website located at
http://dfcn10.info/Pizzahut.com.html infringes and tarnishes Pizza Hut's
mark and name.

Accordingly, Pizza Hut again asks The Planet remove the website located
at the URL http://dfcn10.info/Pizzahut.com.html. 

We look forward to your reconsideration of this take-down request.

Sincerely, 

Julia Anne Matheson
Finnegan, Henderson, Farabow, Garrett & Dunner, LLP
901 New York Avenue NW, Washington, DC 20001 
Tel. 202-408-4020 
Fax 202-408-4400
E-mail: julia.matheson@finnegan.com


________________________________

        From: Copyright [mailto:copyright@theplanet.com] 
        Sent: Friday, March 02, 2007 3:10 PM
        To: Gutowski, Leslie
        Subject: RE: Trademark Infringement; IP addresses 70.87.64.74
and 70.87.64.75; sent on behalf of Julia Anne Matheson, Esq.
        
        

         

        The disputed material in the below-pasted e-mail is the domain
name, not the content of the website. As an ISP, we are compelled by
Federal Law to disable access of website if it infringes copyright or
trademark rights of third parties. This is not the case since the
website www.dfcn10.info neither uses the Trademark PIZZA HUT on his
website nor has PIZZA HUT content display there. As the disputed
material is the domain name and it is not under our control, because it
was not registered with us. This issue should be resolved either by the
registrar of the domain name dfcn10.info or ICANN.

         

        Legal Response Team

         

        ________________________________

                From: Gutowski, Leslie
[mailto:leslie.gutowski@finnegan.com] 
        Sent: Friday, March 02, 2007 8:06 AM
        To: Copyright
        Cc: Matheson, Julia Anne
        Subject: Trademark Infringement; IP addresses 70.87.64.74 and
70.87.64.75; sent on behalf of Julia Anne Matheson, Esq.

         

        March 2, 2007

         

        Via E-mail Only (copyright@theplanet.com)

         

        The Planet.com Internet Services, Inc. d/b/a The Planet

        1333 North Stemmons Freeway, Suite 110

        Dallas, TX  75207

         

        Subject:  Trademark Infringement; IP addresses 70.87.64.74 and
70.87.64.75

        Dear The Planet Representative:

        We represent Pizza Hut, Inc. and its parent company Yum! Brands,
Inc. ("Pizza Hut").  Under penalty of perjury, we declare that the
information contained in this notice is accurate, and that we are
authorized to act on Pizza Hut's behalf in this matter.

        Since its inception in 1958, Pizza Hut has evolved into the
world's largest pizza restaurant company with locations in more than 90
countries around the world.  Pizza Hut owns the trademark and trade name
PIZZA HUT, and owns numerous trademark registrations for that mark in
the United States and other countries worldwide.  Pizza Hut has invested
considerable resources over the years in establishing and promoting its
valuable PIZZA HUT mark and name.  As a result of these efforts, the
PIZZA HUT mark has become famous and an asset of incalculable value.   

        We are writing to notify you that a customer of The Planet is
using your Internet services to infringe Pizza Hut's intellectual
property rights.  Specifically, the customer is operating a pornographic
website located at the URL http://dfcn10.info/Pizzahut.com.html that
uses The Planet's IP addresses 70.87.64.74 and 70.87.64.75.  In addition
to using the PIZZA HUT mark in the URL, this website displays numerous
and gratuitous references to the PIZZA HUT mark and domain name in a
clear attempt to game search engines and increase the amount of Internet
traffic to that website.  The http://dfcn10.info/Pizzahut.com.html
website therefore infringes and tarnishes Pizza Hut's trademark rights.

         

        We have a good faith belief that the use of the PIZZA HUT
trademark on the http://dfcn10.info/Pizzahut.com.html website and in the
URL for that website are not authorized by Pizza Hut, any agent of Pizza
Hut, or under the law.  

         

        Accordingly, Pizza Hut requests that The Planet remove the
website located at the URL http://dfcn10.info/Pizzahut.com.html
<http://dfcn10.info/Pizzahut.com.html> .  In view of the severity and
urgency of this matter, Pizza Hut requests that immediate action be
taken.

         

        We look forward to receiving The Planet's response to this
request.  Thank you for your assistance.

         

        Very truly yours,

        Julia Anne Matheson

        Finnegan, Henderson, Farabow, Garrett & Dunner, LLP

        901 New York Avenue NW, Washington, DC 20001

        Tel. 202-408-4020

        Fax 202-408-4400

        E-mail: julia.matheson@finnegan.com

         

         

         

        
        This e-mail message is intended only for individual(s) to whom
it is addressed and may contain information that is privileged,
confidential, proprietary, or otherwise exempt from disclosure under
applicable law. If you believe you have received this message in error,
please advise the sender by return e-mail and delete it from your
mailbox. Thank you.




This e-mail message is intended only for individual(s) to whom it is
addressed and may contain information that is privileged, confidential,
proprietary, or otherwise exempt from disclosure under applicable law.
If you believe you have received this message in error, please advise
the sender by return e-mail and delete it from your mailbox. Thank you.
dmca.sender_name: Finnegan, Henderson, Farabow, Garrett & Dunner, LLP
dmca.principal_name: Finnegan, Henderson, Farabow, Garrett & Dunner, LLP (for Pizza Hut, Inc. and Yum! Bra
